string.text: Professor, can you deactivate a couple of my items?

I think so, we have a decontamination chamber in the laboratory. But you understand that I can not do this for you for free? I also want to warn you right away that our camera is quite large, and each time we spend almost the same amount of decontamination agents, so it will be more profitable for you to use our services if there are several infected items.
Well, I will take that into account.
That will cost 3000 UAH. Are you agree?
Yes, do it.
Maybe later.
Just a moment, I'll fix the gloves ... Let's get your things here.
Thank you, Professor.
Looks like I forgot them somewhere, I'll be back.
Who else but a technician should know how to repair weapons and equipment, right? Tell me what they do in the Zone. I've been here quite recently.
What I know - I'll tell you. Ask what interests you.
Tell me about barrel replacing.
Tell me about the costume disassembly.
Tell me about the costume repair.
Tell me about the gun repair.
Tell me about weapons dismantling.
Tell me about the handmade cartridges.
Tell me about something else.
I'm not interested in anything.

The gun barrel is a delicate thing. To replace it, you need two things: the barrel itself and the replacement kit. The barrel is usually either bought or obtained from a gun by hand, from a knife to a sledgehammer. Rusty or dead barrels will not work, so they will need to be cleaned and tidied up. They are cleaned here by different means: gasoline, kerosene, vodka, water, solvents, cleaning kits and many others. Kits for replacement are different, that is, for each caliber has its own set. Basically, these field kits are available from dealers. Also, by the way, not every weapon and caliber can be replaced by the barrel, this too.

Well, the suit is not difficult to disassemble, the main thing here is accuracy. Disassembled mainly in sets, they are sold by merchants. There are sets for killed suits, and there are sets more delicate - for new ones. All important details are cut out of suits, the rest is thrown away, because here, in the Zone, there is no benefit from such trifles. Then, with the received spare parts, they repair their equipment or sell it. Still, as a rule, only those suits are dismantled, from which there is something to get. For example, it makes no sense to even spend your time and money on jackets or raincoats, and some live here on disassembling exoskeletons.

In the field, repairing suits is better than artisanal, of course, difficult, but possible. Almost everything is used in the repair: from a rag to heavy armor plates. But the consumables themselves will not stick to the suit, so you still need something that can organize this whole thing. Then glue, sewing and repair kits will do, maybe something else. Well, consumables are also important. It's better to use high-quality than any garbage, because it can all cost more than even the technician. Glue, sewing and repair kits can be purchased from merchants. You can get consumables yourself, for example, from disassembling costumes, or you can also buy from merchants.

Weapons in the zone are quite difficult and expensive to maintain. Repair by a professional can be much cheaper almost always, but you yourself simply need to regularly take care of your weapons with the help of improvised tools, since repairs are always more expensive. To repair trunks, just like to repair costumes, consumables and repair kits are needed. For repair, all spare parts can be bought from merchants or obtained by yourself, for example, many manually disassemble the trunks and repair them themselves.

Well, disassembling weapons is probably the easiest. Stalkers use everything that comes to hand, various sets of tools, sometimes they even use cutlery, but remember that you need to disassemble everything carefully. Further, spare parts are used to repair or sell.

Yes, also an interesting topic. More recently, merchants have all kinds of kits for making a cartridge, but any homemade ammunition will be worse than the factory one. Usually they use tools for making a cartridge and materials for them. All this can be bought from merchants. I can't tell further details, because each set has its own instruction. Well, read, it's not difficult to figure it out.

Well, here in the Zone, in general, there are a lot of things that they do. Of rags and vodka - bandages. They themselves sew sleeping bags and backpacks, materials and tools for which almost any trader has. They also love to make cigarettes and jambs from improvised means, but this is more often in Freedom. Yes, a lot of things actually, the main thing is to turn your wit into it - and you will collect the trunk yourself, yes, there were some.
Well, okay. Thanks for the info.
Listen, man, why is the assortment so meager? No costumes, no better weapons.

Yes, the fact is that I can't store whole arsenals here, despite the fact that this is a huge hangar. There are no warehouses here, right? The roof leaks, holes in the walls, and emissions also cause problems. In the best case, you can poke a box of stewed meat. Stalkers order suits and weapons through me or other merchants. Shustry supplies the most expensive weapons, and here in Hollow I mostly hunt for trifles. And to order we carry only for their own.
Thanks, for the clarification.
I would like to make an order.
No, man, you have a rotten reputation. As you correct - come, but for now I will not take risks.
Clear.
Lumberjack, why aren't you offering enhanced guns and suits?
Well, you know, I can't risk such orders with the first newcomer. Earn yourself a reputation and a good relationship - you will be more serious orders.
Clear.
I'm new here and I have questions. Why is it so empty? Is there another crisis in Clear Skies?

It's not a crisis, it's fine, it's just that we don't keep better weapons and armor here. It's banal and unprofitable. Traders, including myself, work on orders, we don't trade hand-to-hand. Mostly from outside the perimeter, the stuff is already delivered here through brokers.
Okay.
I would like to make an order.
Listen, I don't even know why they still haven't kicked you out of the clan. Correct your reputation - come.
Clear.
I would like to make an order.
Man, I only work for my own, and for the rest I'm working on trifles. If you want to get your gear, go to the Lumberjack in Dark Valley or to Nimble.
Clear.
Blackbird, look at all the serious equipment people have, they say they bought it from you. Maybe there's something better for me?
Don't be offended, but you're new here, untested. You can get a better reputation and earn our trust, and you'll get better products.
Okay, I'll be back.
I would like to make an order.
I was ordered not to throw equipment to the left and right to anybody. You are not supposed to make such orders by rank, as you grow up - come.
Clear.
I would like to make an order.
Who the hell are you? Supply is made strictly for the part. Neither shoulder straps, nor our chevrons on you, I do not observe something.
Clear.
Listen, why aren't you offering enhanced guns and suits?
Well, you know, I can't risk such orders with the first comer or newcomer. You do not have to be ranked for making such orders as you grow up - come.
Clear.
I would like to make an order.
You know, I have information that you should not trust. Correct your reputation - there will be a conversation.
Clear.
Colonel, can I get more serious equipment?
We cannot risk such orders with the first counter. Earn yourself a reputation, rank and good relations - your equipment will be more serious. I clearly explained?
Yes, sir.
Colonel, why don't you offer enhanced guns and suits? Even Duty equipment is not in stock.

I do not squander the breech. And I can't risk such orders with the first comer or newcomer. Earn your reputation, rank and good relations here - you will be more serious orders. But if you are not from "Duty", then you can forget about our equipment.
Clear.
I would like to make an order.
No man, I have info that you shouldn't be trusted. You get your reputation right, we'll talk.
Oh, I see.
Man, why aren't you offering enhanced guns and suits?
Relax, I can't risk these orders with a first-time or rookie. If you get a reputation, rank and relationship here, you'll get bigger orders.
Okay.
Why aren't you offering enhanced guns and suits? I can't see even Freedom equipment.

Man, I can't risk these orders with a first-time or rookie. You get a reputation, rank and relationship here, you'll get bigger orders. But if you're not from Liberty, you can forget about our equipment, too.
Okay.
I'd like to make an order.
What? Get away from my shop, man. With your reputation among us, it's amazing that you're still alive.
I'll be back.
Colleague, why aren't you offering enhanced guns and suits?
Where'd you come from? I can't risk these orders with a first-time or newbie. If you get a reputation, rank and relationship here, you'll get bigger orders.
Okay.
Dushman, why don't you offer guns and suits more seriously? You can't even see the Mercenaries' equipment.

And you're a mercenary? Well, then our equipment's not for you either. And I can't risk ordering with the first person I meet or the new guy. You get a reputation, rank and relationship here, you'll get bigger orders.
Professor, I know you don't have much of a choice, but could I buy somehow your suits?

It's difficult, but even though we're in the Zone, supplies sometimes come here as well. Please note that the number of orders will be limited, and so far I can't offer you more than one. However, if you do some work for me... I think you understand me.
Oh, I see.
I'd like to place an order.
You see... We don't trust you very much, but you can always make things right.
I hear you.
Fuck, godfather, where would I get a trumpet trump? Nichrome no one on the basis of dumb.

Well, in the Zone with valleys, the situation is as follows: we do not trade with hands almost, only with slag, because it is not profitable, and we carry to order. I manage the orders here. But if you're kind of muddy or unverified, then do not expect anything better than pasta. And if you're muddy, don't shine at all. You got that?
I got it.
Godfather, I want to order a gun.
No, you don't understand, get out of here.
I'll be back.
Forester, you're kind of a technician, right?
Yeah, I can and I know a lot of things, and there are tools. But I don't help randomly wandering in here, first I build a reputation for myself.
What now?

I see you have earned a good reputation in the arena, which means you can bet and watch the battles! Yeah, yeah, just like the big debt bumps, think of it as my gift to you as a great fighter. Bets for you are purely symbolic from 1 to 5 thousand, the win depends on the number of participants, winners / losers, in general you can win net from 40% of your bet, and 3 times more.
I want to see the fight.
Choose whose fight you want to see:
Man vs. man.
Look what I got:
Two stalkers
Who you betting on?
On the stalker on the left.
On the stalker on the right.
A group of stalkers vs. a group of bandits
On a group of stalkers
On a group of gangsters
"Duty" against the prisoner "Freedom."
Who you betting on?
On "Duty"
On "Freedom"
Military vs. stalker
Who you betting on?
On military
On a stalker
A man with a monster.
Look what I have:
Stalker and pseudo-dog
Who are you betting on?
On stalker
On the pseudo-dog
Duty and a group of snorks
Who are you betting on?
On the "loner"
On a group of snorks
Bandit and bloodsucker
Who are you betting on?
On the bandit
On a bloodsucker
Two military and burer
Who are you betting on?
On the military
On the burer
Monster with a monster.
Look what I have:
Snork vs Snork
Who are you betting on?
Left snork
Right snork
Bloodsucker vs Bloodsucker
Who are you betting on?
Bloodsucker on the left
Bloodsucker on the right
Chimera vs Chimera
Who are you betting on?
Chimera on the left
Chimera on the right
How much do you bet?
I don't have that much money.
I'm not interested in that.
I changed my mind.
What about the money?
Keep your winnings.
It's okay, you lost.
Hello, Sparrow.
Hey.
How's the mood?
It's normal, but it's a little breathtaking. I never thought I'd end up in a monolith.
How long have you been here, where do you come from?

And as a former me, the Zone has long been trampled. I've been hanging out at the bar lately, and I haven't dried up since the whole catavasia thing started here on Radar. Then it became interesting to know what happened and look at the chaos that began! The military are everywhere, the Lithuanians are in full prostration, so I came across experienced guys from the "monolith", except by a miracle did not shoot each other. Well, I helped the guys a little after the shock, decided to go to their base, and then I got used to it kind of.
Why did you decide to stay?

Can't without the Zone. I've been thinking about it, but as I remembered, on a big land with me... ...this unemployment, this lack of perspective and this lack of will... Yeah, yeah, even here, it's more than that. Okay, well, we'll still have time at the base if I survive.
Thank you for talking to me.
Hey, Sapsan, you know about these locks?
Where did you get this?
I needed it from an entrepreneur at a dump site to deliver it somewhere, split the loot equally, huh?
Are you sure?
Let's open it up.
I changed my mind, I'm sorry.
So, uh... look what's in here and take what you like.
Professor, there's a package for you from a businessman in a hoarding shop:
Okay, well... we conspired to have me pay for the delivery. Here's one of these wonderful artifacts:
Hey, are you a local leader here?
Yeah, became a bump in the jail, and I'm gonna die it. What do you want?
Maybe work or something like that?

You're the one who came to work right, there's nothing to sit on your brother's neck. Well, as for "something," I sell gear, you live off the money, download it to me. They call me Afghan and why, don't ask. Do you have any more questions?
Hey, man, you specialize in repairs here?
Oh, wait, you seem normal-- not a pontore. Yeah, I'm a repairman here.
What do you mean "normal"?

Yeah, I am, you know? I got into a zone of foolishness and juveniles because of that fucking beer. Asked "friends" to stand on the lookout while they cleaned the store, so they got a couple of blocks of cigarettes and a case of beer and they're throwing trash at us. Well, these guys, they threw away everything, and I ran the slowest, and they grabbed me shorter. I didn't rat them out, because there's only one fuckin' guy who would've sewed this robbery up, and who knows how I'd be met in a cell after that. I've been on parole for four years and I'm a man. Thought I wouldn't get involved in such stories anymore, find a job and shoot a hut, make my life better...
Well, then what?
Not so lucky for you, sorry.
Oh, fuck you.

Well, it didn't work out any further. There's no work, no money, and there's a buddy I've been doing time with. So the godfather offered to come here. He saw me because I smelled like Carlo's dad on the machines, so I had no choice. I would have gone to the stalkers, but I don't know anybody here, there wasn't even money for a smooth ride, and if the garbage was taken the second time - parole wouldn't have gotten off. But you know, I don't like all this prison romance, these concepts are alien to me, and they are not appropriate here in the Zone. This isn't the zone that's on the big land that could have provided more willpower. I wish I could save up the money and forget the hell out of this place.
Well, that's how it is. What do they call you?
Engineer, I think you understand why.
Greetings, Mentor. What is the "trivial" task?
We need to take over the stalker base on the outskirts. The brothers believe that they will interfere with our plans, and in the future will be a threat to the brotherhood.
Am I going in there alone?

No, not alone. You'll meet another one of our bands, they're acting as storm troopers. I give newcomers some time to spend first with one group and then with another group to make it easier for them to define their place in the fraternity. It's just a shame that the third band is already dead. Okay, run to the mission, come on.
Hello, are you the Inquisitor? My mentor has informed me that from now on I am at your disposal.
You've been a great help to us, he's finally gotten more or less tough guys. Hold a good gun and get some rest, you can take a walk to our BWC base. We'll run a marathon here and I'll call you in.
Okay.
I'm not comfortable asking, but Mentor was talking about some third unit that was destroyed. Who did he mean?
Crystal Group. Once it was our most powerful group of forces, focused on defending the O-Consciousness, the Monolith, the Sarcophagus and its surrounding areas.
But what happened?

Then, as you know, some freak or a group of freaks broke our protective barrier called "Burner" and there came the Woofers, all kinds of "adventurers", even those bastards. I don't have a lot of information, because me and Preacher were doing some fucking... sorry, too many gaps in my old life. In general, I was distracted: the whole group was put under the spotlight, the guys held on to the last one, and could they prevent the threat or not, look for yourself. By the way, you can go through the Sarcophagus, find some information or maybe a weapon. Just grab something to get the radiation out.
I think I'll go. I'm interested in the fate of this group.
Oh, come on, it's too dangerous.
Here, take this. Most of the information is either lost or I don't know how to read it.
I'll tell the Mentor, he'll take care of it later. Sorry, guys.
Why did you decide to stay in the fraternity? From what I understand, you were "zombie" first.

I woke up somewhere near Pripyat, with people I didn't know, and nothing as they didn't remember. All we had in common was the uniform and we didn't let each other down. My old life is behind me, brother - so it happened and nothing can be fixed here. I also found my gun and twenty-two notches on it. I don't think I'll be accepted anywhere else.
What is this place, anyway?

What are you, green or something? I don't know, a dump and a dump. Shitty place really is in terms of radiation and scumbags. There's a big depot on the right of the road, stay out of it, the gangsters have a base there. That's all I know.
What if Voronin finds out what you're doing here?
Know your place, stalker, otherwise you can lose your life. And where are the facts confirming your words? That's the same, there are none of them. Come on, go away, while we are good.
Hi, what is this place?

Dude, this is a flea market. Here stalkers do what they can, so they sell, here to my right behind the counter - our bartender and part-time hunter, though retired. My colleague is sitting on the left of the sofa.
Tell me about this place.
What can I say, the place here is not very pleasant. Radiation at least ass shit, but all kinds of freaks, like dolgars and bandits.
Well, what about the places of interest?

Here you can say the flea market is the main pearl, and the rest ... there is a railway to the north of the depot, do not pop into it, there the bandits rebuilt the camp. Further north is the direct road to the bar, where the post of dolgars is standing there. Near here, near the exit to the cordon, there is some kind of substation, but no one pokes in there, the place is bad, and the anomalies are full. Yes, by the way, we have as many as three abnormal zones nearby, and one of them, unfortunately, is in the substation itself, where electrons spark everywhere. These stalkers chose places and didn't allow anyone to approach them, though the bandits didn't need to, they didn't come to get artifacts here, but to steal from those who actually got them, therefore their place is so “strategically advantageous”, that is, approach to the bar. Well, the beast here is docile, at least on the surface and if you do not climb into the substation. There is one tunnel in which a piece of iron leads from the depot and the devil knows what is there, but the bandits generally do not go there. I feel that there are such samples of local fauna gathered, eh.
Oops, new faces in my eatery. Well, hi, man.
Hey, are you a part-time job as a cook?

Yeah, well, that was a little useful for me, though. Hold the water, from the bottom of your heart. If you want a drink, a snack and a sip, you found the right place. We don't have 100 X-rays here, but we don't have any fags, all guys are straight, spoons aren't holes in gums.
Let there be time, I will.
Is there anything else you can do for fun?

I'm not your fucking clown. You puzzled me, though, anyway. How about some Russian roulette? I got an old Nagan here, playing the whole drum. I'm not gonna shoot myself, of course. I'm gonna shoot in the air. If you win, 5000 is yours.
Come on, then.
Hey, brother. I was supposed to get something from the Wings.
Whoo, here's your Abakan.
So, huh - earned the respect of "Wings"? Well done, you'll go far. Keep your squad branded bodysuit.
Your face is painfully sour, isn't it recoverable?

Not at the moment. Someone must have taken apart the remote control, but that's half the trouble. There's a faulty cooling system, we'll have to inspect it, but I doubt I'll be strong enough here. But that's not your problem anymore, right? Look, have you ever been assigned to any other squad?
I don't think so, Mentor said to go to you in a message and that's it.
I think you have some potential in you. I'd like to thank our entire group and give you our signature combs, you deserve it.
Thank you.
Great, I'll let the base know. Go to the supplier in Pripyat, he'll give you our uniforms, I think you'll be pleasantly surprised. By the way fighter, I hope to see you in our lines in the future.
What do you want from me?
Protect this place with the guys while I try to assess the situation. I think the creatures here will bother us more than once.
And you must be our new companion. So, ready to take a walk and see the former greatness of this place?
Hi, are you "Wings"? Tell me about you and the situation that we forgot here?

"Wings," exactly what's left of them. They call me Griffin, those guys over there are Sparrow and Pegasus, the vain man with the SVD is the Wind. So listen, there used to be a lot of us here, and this place was terrifying to the hearts of the infidels. Until one of the stalkers sabotaged the local zombie station, so to speak. And what started here, it had to be seen - "Duty", "Liberty", loners and military. Our best units took the most powerful blow, as a result: all dead. But in fact, no one managed to get hold of this place, I do not know what happened here, but these places are now inhabited by all kinds of creatures and zombies, among others.

Now we need to go to the bunker under the installation of the so-called "Burner" and assess the situation, to answer one of the main questions facing the current brotherhood: "Is it realistic to restart this installation?" Are you ready?
I'm ready, let's go.
Not ready, I'll take a look around for a while.
I'm here about an assignment.

These "Cossacks" were sniffing out the activity of our patrols on Radar and the periphery of Pripyat. I want you to make a choice how we deal with this next, it will be a test of your thinking abilities.
I think we need to deal with their nearest bridgehead, that is, the barrier. We need to discourage them from spying.
We should find the rest of the intelligence team. I don't think the two of them acted together.
Yeah, well, in that case, you can go storming. Hold a dozen grenades, let's see how you handle it, since you suggested it. The brotherhood has no soldiers.

And you're damn right it is. Except that's how bad their PDA reports are. One of our recruits you were standing with earlier was supposed to steal heels of Monolithic combs from a warehouse and give them to saboteurs. We'll take care of the rest of the grief scouts ourselves, you gotta figure out this spy. I called the recruits, they should be here, they also know that I have a serious conversation with everyone, ask them what I would like them to do.
Here you go:
Um, what kind of box is this?
What's my next challenge?
Follow me.
You see these beauties? Take them and kill them. That's how you prove your loyalty to our cause. Come on, brother, no shadow of a doubt.
Okay.

Well done! These cattle tried to break through to the center, but our guys took them, pre-stunned by the explosion. Now I'll have the other test subjects cut off their heads and pack them in a nice box. Come back in an hour, you're gonna have to run for a while.
Well, hello there, brother. Why are you here?
Well, you called me for something.
Because of the money, brother.
I came here for my secret desire.
At the call of the heart. I came here to defend our Monolith.

Hmm and where do you come from such jokers. In general, the "Monolith" is not the same as before. Roughly speaking, fraternity is supported only by a handful of enthusiasts. After disabling the Burner, many fell out of the ranks of the group. Some stayed here simply because they would die outside the brotherhood, but that does not mean that sooner or later they will leave. And some, like I stayed here only because they want to build their personal paradise and the technologies of "O-Consciousness", allow themselves to do this ...

At least honestly. In general, the "Monolith" is not the same as before. Roughly speaking, fraternity is supported only by a handful of enthusiasts. After disabling the Burner, many fell out of the ranks of the group. Some stayed here simply because they would die outside the brotherhood, but that does not mean that sooner or later they will leave. And some, like I stayed here only because they want to build their personal paradise and the technologies of O-Consciousness, allow themselves to do this ... you are honestly speaking an interesting case.

Here it is the very thing that keeps people like us in brotherhood. In general, the "Monolith" is not the same as before. Roughly speaking, fraternity is supported only by a handful of enthusiasts. After disabling the Burner, many fell out of the ranks of the group. Some stayed here simply because they would die outside the brotherhood, but that does not mean that sooner or later they will leave. And some, like we stayed here only because we want to build our own personal paradise and the technologies of "O-Consciousness", allow themselves to do this ...

Don't make me laugh. In general, the "Monolith" is not the same as before. Roughly speaking, fraternity is supported only by a handful of enthusiasts. After disabling the Burner, many fell out of the ranks of the group. Some stayed here simply because they would die outside the brotherhood, but that does not mean that sooner or later they will leave. And some, like I stayed here only because they want to build their personal paradise and the technologies of "O-Consciousness", allow themselves to do this ...
Did you talk about some trials?

There is a time for everything, a new brother. Remember that your past life is coming to an end. The brotherhood eventually became even smaller, but much more embittered. What you have to go through here, in particular during the tests, will seem like a real horror to any objectively normal person. To begin with, I want to see your will, I'm taking all your equipment from you and I want you to kill a pseudo-giant who has settled nearby. And how you do it - whether with your bare hands, with the help of your brothers or with the help of a found weapon, this does not bother me. So you show yourself what you are capable of achieving the goal and what means you are likely to resort to. Give me your stuff.
Um, okay.
The creature is dead. But why do we kill them, unless they can become our allies in the fight against ... infidels.

The forces of "O-Consciousness" are not even enough to keep a handful of people in check, and you're talking about mutants. Well done, your things are in the blue box here, you can pick them up. When you are ready for the next challenge, come.
Howdy, Barman. I visited the factory in Polyana, found some records. Interested in?

Come here, let's see what kind of garbage ... so, well, it's only that some sofa anonymous or collectors will appreciate, you can safely wipe with these pieces of paper. But for the solution to the secrets of the plant respect, of course, keep some money:
Well, I'm ready.
Well, I'm directly eager to find out all the secrets of this place. But be on the lookout, I hope we can do without incident.
Hmm ...

That's always like that, understand? Again nearly died and again you saved me. And there was nothing ... There you have the moral, man: rely only on objective, versatile information, draw his mother's parallels and don't live in pink glasses. Ugh, bitch!
What's next?
Will you give me the documents? After a sortie to my memory, I'll keep it. Unfortunately, there is nothing to pay you back, but I can become you a good friend if you want to wander with me.
Yes, hold on, they do not need me.
Are you kidding me? I risked my life because of you, and three times. I'd better go give the bartender.
Howdy, man. Thank you very much, otherwise I think the bloodsucker would gobble up me, the door is rather flimsy.
How did you end up here?
As banal as it may sound, I was looking for something to eat here.
Did you find anything?
Nope, only ruin and dust. Listen, if you want to make some money, I have a proposal.
What did you want to offer me?

This is all a factory. You know, the place here is certainly not the "first freshness", but no one has come here, since frankly there are not a lot of artifacts here, and it is dangerous here for the outskirts of the Zone. But recently rumors about a local plant began to go, they say that some kind of weapon is stored here, which the government was developing after the first explosion. Well, you probably know stories about the Marked and the Strelka, which almost all the underground complexes have plundered? And here is the hope for newcomers without delving into the center to get something that is valuable and expensive. So they popped here, and I am among them, and after us the bandits, since where there are stalkers, there you can get hold of swag.
Would you like to invite me together to search for valuable information in this place?

Yeah. But first, please help me, it's better not to hang around here without a gun. I had a good shotgun, I collected money for it before I came here, but I went to the local substation (it's not far from here) and there was some strange anomaly, well, in general I was careless and it just hit! Good thing I was not hurt, but I really screwed up, so I threw the gun and ran here. You can laugh, but when it's a miracle I didn't die... Anyway, will you get it for me? Oh, and, uh, if you want to help me with something else.
Well, I'm going to get your shotgun.
Not now.
Take your gun, and the anomaly is so strange really, I haven't seen such electro.
Thank you, take this as a token of gratitude, I found it nearby. Get ready well, come one night, let's go to the factory.
Honestly, I was already at the factory.
Come on man, don't lie. Do you have evidence?
Yes, that's all I found there:
No.

In business, but ... there are no miracles. Thank you for at least clarifying the situation, and it looks dangerous there. You have nothing to pay me back except for your shotgun. Hold on, I won't need him anymore:
Well, do not fuck me up.
Grandmas and artifacts drive fast, bitch!
Here, take that I managed to sell, there's no art, believe me, please:
Grandmas and artifacts drive fast, bitch!
Take what is, do not shoot only:
And what is interesting in those rooms behind the guard?

Not what, but who. There is an experienced person alone there, he can get what unique equipment you want. But now I won't let you go there. First I have to make sure that you can be trusted, that is, you must have a good reputation.
Well, now can I go to this person?
Hmm, yes. I will warn Garik, that person's name is Nimble. Right and right along the corridor.
And what is interesting in those rooms behind the guard?

Not what, but who. There is an experienced person alone there, he can get what unique equipment you want. Hmm, I know you as a reliable person with a good reputation. You can tell Garik to let you in and go to this man whom they call the nimble. Right and right along the corridor.
I need to get through.
Wow, you and your detachment broke through the Burner and stayed there for half a year?
Well, not half a year, but a little over a month. Yes, that was me. Lukash, nice to meet you.
And how was it, tell me, eh?
Listen, well, I don't want to stir up the past, we got out and that's fine.
Oh, and thanks for that.
Well hello, Gatekeeper.
So you are going to Limansk? If it weren't for Leshiy, well, you understand. Welcome and come on here, just be careful and try not to get on our patrols, you have no agreements with them.
I collected the money.
You can go to the beach now, I warned them. You'll be contacted by a mercenary named "The Gatekeeper", act on circumstances. And find something to shed some light on Scar's disappearance, please.
Hey, Lukash. I'd like to find Leshyi, is there a man like you?
Why would you do that? Well, you're lucky enough to get down to the ground floor, he'll be standing downstairs.
Thank you, finally.
You're Leshyi, right?
Yeah, you need a guide or how...
"Or how." Anyway, I know something about your past and I could use your help, mercenary.
Um... what kind of help?

Can you negotiate with those mercenaries who guard the bridge in Redwood? I have to go to Limansk. I know this sounds cocky, but I can promise you that I'll try to find all the traces that may have been left of Scar.

You know, it's been a long time since I've been in the syndicate, I don't even know who runs that group by the bridge. I've got some other connections, so I just need some time. In the meantime, you'll get the money, yes, yes - the most common rustling money, a thousand edas 150 at least.
Hello to you, Lesnik. I'm here because I want to get to the other side of the bridge.
Over a bridge, then? That's got nothing to do with me, go with the people who hold the bridge now.
You may have remembered, but it's thanks to you that Limansk is now crawling with mercenaries.
I haven't memorized it, but I don't want to help you either. I'm still not sure if I did the right thing helping that "mercenary."
Look, please help me. Who cares if you did the right thing or not? Either way, I can find out if I go into town.
Look, if you don't tell me everything quickly, I'll write you a trip to the morgue.
Old man, if the Zone wants me there, I'll be there. But it's in your best interest to help me now, because no one if it'll favor you next time.

Eh, that's true. I saw something special in Scar, and Zone needed him. And you... yeah, I'd like to know what happened to him. So listen: we helped get the "mercs" out of the bubble. Then, when everything settled down - they came to me, led by Leshiy. It must have been one of those who said that I also took part in the rescue. So I talked to Leshiy, he gave me some provisions, money and ammunition, and left. He said he went to the Army warehouses, to Freedom. That was where you should look for him. It's true that several years had passed, but judging from our conversation, he seriously intended to join them.
I've heard something about the story of "Clear Sky" and I'd like to follow in the footsteps of your group.
What are you doing looking for? Ha, listen to this. You don't stand a chance of surviving in those parts, but even if you do, it's gonna be really hard to find information about our stay there.
Cold, aren't you interested? Or what you want for detailed information.
Uh, okay. But first help us lime a pack of swamp bloodsuckers and then I'll tell you everything.
Give me the coordinates of these humanoids.
Fuck you, suck on your own bloodsuckers.
I could barely handle them. Let's get the info in there now.

The Observers have already reported to me, well done. Well, you're a fighter, then. So listen: the guys were telling me how the damn bridge in Limansk was stormed. In case you didn't know, in the city, as well as on the way to it from the Red Forest, the mercenaries are running everything. Of course, they won't lower the bridge for you, but there's still a living participant in those events and call him "The Forester". It was he who somehow agreed with Scar that a group of "merks" would lower the bridge while our fighters were covering them from the other side. I think you should go to the "Lesnik" and talk to him. And here's the details of the passage to the "Red Forest" from "Militari", if you don't already have, and a small reward for the bloodsuckers.
Thank you.
Check me, but watch out for your hands!
Ahh... Okay, you wait...
Got arms and legs, you're right.
Well, what's up? Does it suck at all? What the fuck are you talking like a fish?

Truth be told, bro, you can get a first-aid kit or two, but not the fact that it'll help. And I have a real topic, we'll make it for 2500 UAH. I've got one syringe, I'm going to fall down, heals everything, but you won't stop glowing... In general, without a normal antidote, it's gonna get worse. Finish 3000 UAH from the top and all this will pass. Well, did you finish it?
Oh, for fuck's sake, you're gonna get paid again... Take it, molded it.
No, fuck, just get the radiation out. I'll patch the rest up at these prices myself.
You didn't make, you fucking robbed, you fucking robbed your brother.
I'm not fucking around in this, but I think you should feel better. Look, don't fucking fall apart.
Everything, although there's still... Karoche, I didn't put you in, you put me in. If you die at an angle, it's not my fault. Do you understand? I got it.
You're filtering the market, okay? You die in here somewhere, it's not my fault. Now get out of here.
Hey, man, you waiting for someone?

Oh, hey! You don't need a guide? So, look where I can safely take you: 
%c[255,238,153,26]• Cordon [Rookie village] 
%c[255,238,153,26]• Swamps [Hidden base] 
%c[255,238,153,26]• Garbage [Junkyard]
Remind me where your routes lead?

%c[255,238,153,26]• Cordon [Rookie village, 1000] 
%c[255,238,153,26]• Swamps [Hidden base, 2500] 
%c[255,238,153,26]• Garbage [Junkyard, 2500]
I need your help.
Where are we going?
To Cordon %c[255,238,153,26][Rookie village, 1000]
To the Swamps %c[255,238,153,26][Hidden base, 2500]
To garbage %c[255,238,153,26][Junkyard, 2500]
Perhaps I changed my mind.
Hi, who are you?

I'm a conductor calling Leopard. As you can see, the "dead city" is surrounded on all sides by all sorts of enemies, but few people know about the underground sewer network, but I know. And we can safely go outside the city, and then I can take you to one of our bases. True, there are not very many of them:\n%c[255,238,153,26]• Red Forest [outpost behind the bridge]
Remind me where your routes lead.
Look: \n%c[255,238,153,26]• Red Forest [outpost in front of the bridge, 2500]
I want to leave the city.
Where are we going?
To the Red Forest %c[255,238,153,26]["outpost in front of the bridge", 2500]
Perhaps I changed my mind.
Howdy, what are you doing?

I can ask you a very reasonable question: "And you fuck?". But something still concerns you, namely, I provide services for "my" - the services of a guide. I know short and safe routes to:\n%c[255,238,153,26]• "Dead City" [Trade cooperative] \n%c[255,238,153,26]• Red Forest [outpost behind the bridge]
Remind me again, where do your routes lead?
Here: \n%c[255,238,153,26]• "Dead city" [Trade cooperative, 8000] \n%c[255,238,153,26]• Red Forest [outpost behind the bridge, 2500]
I need your services.
Where to?
In the "Dead City" %c[255,238,153,26][Trade cooperative, 8000]
To the Red Forest %c[255,238,153,26]["outpost behind the bridge", 2500]
Perhaps I changed my mind.
I want to buy info about the cache.
Prepared money? 5000 UAH
Hold on.
Not.
I send coordinated to your device. What is in the cache is unknown, maybe nothing at all.
I saw that weirdo with a dog and even talked to him.
Oh, how, but I already forgot about this request. So what is there?
Yes, as always, no specifics, Lassie her name said, they say. Well, there are two more puppies with her, also, like they did not show signs of aggression.

Puppies? Oh, what only in the zone you will not see. Well, thanks, I'll know now that we're not the only Doc who has such a “dog breeder”. If necessary, take the info about the transition of one, from the military to the Red Forest. We got an echo of the past adventures of the group, well, a bit of provisions.
Who are you?
I am an informant here and can offer you all kinds of services. At the moment, this is various information and maps with paths to a particular location. Don't ask where it comes from.
Do you have the latest information?
I am ready to share with you information about the marsh doctor for 7000.
There is information about a strange stalker who is looking for the Gunslinger group for 10,000.
I have information shedding light on the second shutdown of the "Brain Scorcher" for 15,000.
I have information about the adventures of the mysterious stalker on the "Generators" for 24,000.
Not at the moment.
Come on.
This is not interesting to me.

The old man is now in the Swamps, everything is waiting for his friend, “Gunslinger”. Recently, a guy came to him, to whom the Doctor told his story, and what is important - the story of the Gunslinger group itself! You can personally go to him and see.

This same stalker who went to the Doctor is now looking for traces of the Gunslinger group. He has already researched laboratories in Dark Valley and Yantar and is clearly not going to stop there. Judging by verified sources, he wants to break into the center of the Zone and finish what the aforementioned group of stalkers could not for one reason or another.

This is the same stalker and he turns off the "Brain Scorcher"! I wonder when they guess at least somehow harm the control panel, and not masturbate the switch every time? Rumor has it that he is now going to Pripyat and that he had some kind of assignment from the Doctor. I don't know if the old man wants to find his friend in this way or whether something more is hidden behind this.

Have you ever heard of Generators? Until recently, this place was considered only a myth, but after the second campaign of the Strelka group to the center of the Zone, all doubts were dispelled. There is persistent debate about what is located there, but old satellite images indicate some strange infrastructure, after which this place was named. Apparently, the Monolith group is controlled from there, as well as all the important processes in the Zone. So our stalker has already gone there and I think he is serious, probably his intervention could lead to serious changes in the Zone, the leaders of some groups have already expressed their dissatisfaction with this information.
I want to buy info on various transitions.
Look what I have:
From Army Warehouse to Radar %c[255,238,153,26][25000]
From Radar to the bunker below it %c[255,238,153,26][37500]
From Radar to Central Pripyat %c[255,238,153,26][50000]
From central Pripyat to the outskirts %c[255,238,153,26][100000]
From central Pripyat to NPP %c[255,238,153,26][150000]
From the southern part of the NPP to the northern %c[255,238,153,26][175000]
I changed my mind.
Do you have the money with you?
No.
Yeah, here you go.
Do you need any help, Noah?
Well, I have a few things to do:
Bring in a new shotgun.
Deal with the snorks on the South Plateau.
Sorry, I changed my mind.

I don't like mine at all, so if you brought me something like "Saiga"... but I don't know if I can get a weapon like that in the Zone. But I've seen a couple of bandits with Protekta, bring me a gun like that.

It's time to finish with these creatures, they want to kill me day and night, they just have a raging hatred for me, I can feel it. Every night I hear the breath of one of these things crawling near the barge. Waiting and sniffing. To get to the plateau, you'll have to use the teleporter, I marked it on the map, it's not far from the "burnt-out farm".
Keep your "Protecta".
Great, thank you. Now these things are gonna think three times before they get in here.
I screwed up those snorks, a lot of them were there. And why are they hunting you?
I don't know... I used to go there occasionally and clean things up, but now I don't have time to watch the puppies. Thank you.
Easy, easy, don't shoot! You almost killed me!
Why did you even come here? Go on, don't waste my time.
I got it. Okay, don't get too excited, do you need any help? Answer a few questions?
Come on, don't just piss off.
I have a few questions.
Where did you get that dog?
Why do you live on this boat?
Why don't you trust people?
I should probably go.

This is Lassie. Nice bitch ... If not for her, they would have devoured me in a dream a long time ago. Damned mutants ... I hate it! Only you close your eyes - and they are already there, pulling claws, fangs, feeling ...
Oh, I see.
Why would she have puppies if she's always hanging around you?
It's the Ark! Remember... If you want to live, remember! When the Wave goes, be there for it. Here - you have a chance to survive... No mutant will get through here.
What the fuck is the wave, where did you get that from?

Because these creatures are watching me day and night. You don't understand ... those snorts from the southern plateau followed me right up to the "Ark"! I'm an experienced hunter and I know that they wouldn't give a damn about chasing the victim for so long. But here something is unclean, it seems to me that they have a reason. I don't know what a collective, or perhaps a protectorate, was seeking ... and my guesses were only confirmed by the recent attack of these creatures on a barge.
Okay, this is the Zone. Anything can be here, but if your guesses are correct, then we are now in a deep ass.
I have survived too much.
Well, what's your special case?

You will see in a moment. As you know, the most dangerous enemy to man is man. There's an ATP near here, and there's a group of unscrupulous individuals who are shaking down everyone, and I'm getting pretty fed up with it. We need to deal with them once and for all. All right, are you in? Grab a better gun and plenty of ammo, cause it's gonna get hot.
I'm in, let's go.
Sorry, but somehow without me.
Yeah... What a bunch of bastards...

How's that? Have you tasted blood? Heh-heh! Soon you'll be a real shark. Murder's a way to get rich around here, too, and stop thinking yourself up. If it ain't you, it'll be you. A dead man doesn't need the loot, as you know. Well, let's go to the village.
Eh, it's a good thing there are people like you. Why would you doing this?

Who else but me? Wolf used to watch the village... Till something got into his head and he packed up and left for the center of the Zone. What for? Why? Hell knows. Maybe he'll come back. I don't think I'm getting out of here. Who am I going to leave people like you here for? How many more of you will there be? Here's a tried-and-true route to the garbage. Right on the road, over the bridge, then you'll know from the map. And keep this, so ours in the village will know you're one of their own. Now you can consider yourself a Stalker.
I'm ready now what?

Now listen to me carefully, stalker. To survive, and not just survive, you have to search. And he who seeks, finds. Like someone else's stash. What? Not fair? Not fair? We're in the zone. And if you don't get your noble impulses up and running, you're not gonna last long here. Now keep looking. I got a backpack hidden around here somewhere. See if you can find it. When you find it, bring me its contents.
I found your stash. I see you've got a sense of humor, joker.

Excellent! You are not as bad as you seem. I can't disappear with your attention in the Zone. And do not throw this jar out; you can still bungle out of it if your hands grow from the right place. Get ready for now, I have a special case for you.

That's great! You're not as bad as you look. With your attentiveness you won't get lost in the Zone. And don't throw that tin away, you can still make something out of it if your hands grow from the right place. In the meantime prepare yourself, I have a special job for you.
Another one, coming in here like it's a honeydew. You're lucky you made it to the village. Why don't you come with me and I'll show you the local specialties and see what kind of fruit you are.
Come on, look, no surprises.
Thanks of course, but I don't have time for this.

Listen to me and stay close, then there won't be any surprises. So, one of the big dangers in the Zone is mutants. Even the smallest beast can get you into a lot of trouble. There's a herd of boars just off the road, we've got to deal with them, it's getting dangerous. Don't get in front of me, if they come at you, find a higher place where they can't get you!
Is your offer still valid? You were going to show the neighborhood.

Yes, still valid. So, the first of the dangerous things that are here are mutants. It's been a while since we went hunting, and we're going to fix it now. Grisha noticed some wild boars in a ravine not far away. We will deal with them. Be careful, these aren't simple boars. Aim for the torso or back, they have a stronger snout. Shall we go?
Of course, let's go.
First need to prepare, a little later.
Huh, knock them off. One fanger almost grabbed me.

So, how do you like the local fauna? That's not what you're gonna see here. Here's my hunting knife, and you can't open cans with yours. You can't go anywhere in the Zone without a good knife. You can use it to cut mutants with thinner skins, and for a bigger creature you'll need something bigger. Sometimes you have to eat whatever you find, and the meat of mutated creatures is not an exception, but without the right preparation, I would not advise you to risk your life. There's Gourmet in the village, go to him, he'll tell you anything you want to know about it. Scientists have settled in the north, they have requests for mutant samples. The thing is, of course dirty... Gut those beasts, but what can't you do for money, huh? Come on, knife in your hands and get the trophies, and I'll cover you for now. When you're done, let's move on to a pile of anomalies, stop at the radioactivity sign.
What's next?

Well, here we are. This is the death of all inattentive and careless - anomalies. Take something and throw it in front of you, so you can make sure everything is clear ahead. According to my detector, there's a "Jellyfish" artifact around here somewhere. Artifacts have both positive and negative properties, and in this case, we're pretty lucky. Here's my old detector, you can use it to detect some other artifacts, but don't forget to return it later, it's pretty expensive. Also take this one, you can take it all at once before you go in there. Oh, I almost forgot. Be careful when you come into contact with those "rocks" with your bare hands. They can hit you so hard that the dental filling will fly off, and you'll ruin your equipment. The artifacts are radioactive, and I don't recommend keeping them in your bare hands for a long time, and your items in the backpack will be irradiated, until you put them in a container, so here we must act quickly and accurately. There's a box nearby, you can put your stuff there temporarily. Come on, I'll cover you from here, don't get in trouble!
Look, I found it!

Well, keep it for yourself, it has the ability to absorb different types of radiation, but it won't hurt you right now. I don't advise to shine with these trinkets here, there are a lot of people who want to rob you to the skin, so keep in mind. And do not carry these artifacts with you in your pockets, if you do not want to shine at night like a garland. Listen to my advice and you will make a good stalker. That's it, let's go back to the village, we'll give a hint there.
Wow, I can see why everyone's so eager to get in here. It's all clear on the artefacts, what's next?

And here's what's going to happen, I'm going to take this stone away from you, come on, come on. I'll save you from trouble, and you'll thank me later. Give me back my detector and knife, because I'm too fond of them, you can keep the trophies.
Leave me something, I helped you fight back too.

Don't make me say it twice. Give me back the knife, the detector and the artifact. Did I mess with you for nothing? Covering for you, setting yourself up. Come on, come on, don't waste time if you want to stay in this village.
I can't find where I put your knife.
Do not test my patience, return my knife.
I can't find where I put the artifact.
You think I'm stupid? You think I didn't see you try to hide it? Get it over here.
I think I lost your detector.
Nice try, but it's not gonna work, give it back to me.
Here, take your stuff!
Very good. Come as soon as you get settled in here, I have one more thing for you. Here's a knife sharpening stone for you, you'll need it.
Hey, stalker. You need something?
A? Is that you...
I need medical attention.
Well, let me see...
Don't make laugh, everything is fine with you.
[further...]
Well, that's it, you can go.
Hi, is there a special job?

Of course there is, I saw how many zombies gathered here in a landfill? Very strange, before this was not. In general, now I will give you the coordinates of the largest cluster of these creatures, and you will clean everything up there thoroughly. Well how?
Come on
No, I don't want anything.
Hold the coordinates. Be careful there.
Everything is ready, oh, and there were many of them there ...

Oh well done. From Yantar, the creature must be a rod. By the way, did you know that there is a direct road to the "wild territory" from here? If not, give me a PDA - I'll outline how to get there. Well, do not forget the reward.
Tell me about yourself.

Oh, yes I'm here someone like a local bartender or a food manager, as you prefer. We can say that I am one of the few who participated in the liquidation of the accident at the nuclear power plant. I'm not local, but I decided to go to the zone under the contract. There is no experience, ha.
And how was it there?

Yes, I was still an conscript, I was only lucky to measure the general background with the guys, and to participate in the “sweeps” of radiation. Here about those who heard at the station, yes - they were lucky to be in the ass. What a man there, even the equipment died from the radiation, so you estimate and they threw off this graphite with shovels from the roof. Although radiation is a strange thing, whom it doesn't spare, and Dyatlov survived and went to the bunk.
Tell me about yourself.

I'm a military medic, contracted to come here and almost immediately I was assigned to the "Farwater Group" after some training. We got stuck in Pripyat once after an operation collapsed, well, whoever was left alive... then an SBU officer helped us, and then they took us away. I can't get one case out of my head: our direct superior sent me and a couple of lads to a kindergarten where, according to preliminary data, there was a device which disturbed radio communication. When we got there, I don't know what came over me, I wasn't myself, I couldn't see where the guys had gone, I couldn't see, I was like a blur in front of my eyes. So right there in the kindergarten I found some goddamn refrigerator and climbed in. Then I heard an explosion right above me and immediately felt better, but the fridge was locked for some reason and I couldn't get out without help. I don't remember if I locked myself in or if a poltergeist was holding the door...
And then what, why didn't quit?

Yes, I need the money, otherwise why else would I have come here. And the doctors are good, and not so good in the army now. At least they didn't demote me for failing the operation, but they didn't praise me either, unlike the Major, who by the way is also hanging around here somewhere in the Zone.
All right, good luck with that. Now I'll know and I won't go to that kindergarten again.
Buddy, can you patch me a little?
Hey, I dug up a recorder somewhere.
Military? Come on. It's a good thing, take the money for it.
I found a flight recorder here.
So, come on here. Let's see what these bastards are plotting.
Now, I found this recorder under the rubble of a helicopter.
Great find, maybe we can find the cause of these air raids on the marshes.
Brother, I dug up an onboard recorder here.
Give it here, let's see what the military is up to this time.
Are you interested in helicopter recorders?
Of course, give it here.
I picked up a recorder from a helicopter crash.
Thank you, give it here.
Hey, don't you trade info about stashes?
At a flea market, almost everyone is being traded. Six thousand and I will mark you the coordinates.
I need information about stashes, I have money %c[255,238,153,26][6000]
Catch the coordinates.
Do you have information on the location of any stashes?
Oh, of course! There's been a lot of people here. I don't want to go around the Zone on my own, so I'm selling for six and a half for a tip.
I need information about the places of stashes, I have money %c[255,238,153,26][7000]
Here are stash coordinates.
Hello, can you find information about the location of some stashes?
You can find everything, and you have the money? Thanks to the information from the PDA shaft, and I don't fucking need those schemes. Eight grand for this one, and no less.
I need information about the stashes, I have the money. %c[255,238,153,26][8000]
Catch the coordinates.
Howdy, man. You don't mess around with information about different stashes?
And where did you smell it from? Yeah, well, as far as the pahan goes, it's settling. Anyway, 7K and it's yours.
I need information on the locations of the stashes, I have the money... %c[255,238,153,26][7000]
Here are the coordinates.
Hello, barman. Can I get some information on the location of some stash from you?

Yes, I often have stalkers in the bar as a thank-you or just drunk talk about their schemes, but do not think that it will cost you cheap, even though I do not know what may be there. 7000 and the stash is yours.
I need information about the hiding places, I have the money. %c[255,238,153,26][7000]
Catch the coordinates.
Hey, you're a local supply man, right? Do you provide any services?
Oh, what a provider I am now. No, I'd rather need the services. Come back a little later, I can give you a job looking for different ammunition and weapons for our guys.
Hey, what are the mercenaries doing here?

We're stuck, man. You're not going forward for a reason, we can't back down either. Not only are the tracks cut off, but Dushman's also very angry with us, I guess he won't miss an opportunity to get even with us.
What happened?

Performed some order of the customer, but failed. The military liquidated most of ours, the bitches and all the information from the lab near here were raked out. I don't want to talk about it in general. If you're looking for a job, you can find it from me.
Hello, I saw your message. Why are you so kind all of a sudden?

Why are you doing this out of the blue? Don't abuse our hospitality. We've got business on the beard, that's all. Because of the military who used to hang around here, we lost some important people, and we never managed to find the information we needed and access to some places. If we go back to Dushman, he will tear off our genitals and make us eat them, so we have settled here for now, and I see no point in feuding with loners.
And what kind of help do you need?

All kinds of things. We don't have any supplies or equipment here, just what's left of the intermediaries to do the operation. You can also talk to our supply man, he'll share some excess equipment with you for a fee. And by the way, if you decide to get out of this hole, my guys can help. We've already done an extensive study of the local underground network.
Is there any special work?

Got it. We actually came here for the information from the X-8 laboratory, it's in the local KBO, it's enough to go down to the "minus first floor" in the elevator, but we were prevented by the damned military. And now we're in such a deplorable position because of them. We don't care about Dushman, but maybe there's still some paperwork left. That's how we'd have thought about getting out of here by now. I'd go there with the guys, but there's not enough of us left, and we've got to get out of the goddamn zone somehow. \nI suggest you go should go to X-8, what's left of it, and you'll make good money at the same time. Hi, why are you dressed up like a bandit?

Oh you. Hunter I, the truth you can understand - there are few of us left. I keep a small bar here, the places are safe and generally not bad, and if you have questions, ask. By the way, they call me a Butcher.
Who are the hunters in the "Zone"?

Well, we are doing pretty specific leisure here. We do not collect artifacts, do not adhere to any general views on the zone and do not try to unravel its secrets. We simply hunt mutants, and not because they, in our opinion, pose any threat, as it seems to “Duty,” but because we can and want to. Many of us were former hunters, both amateurs and professionals on the mainland, though many perished. \nAbout the cloak, by the way, did you notice, so it's much more convenient to hunt in them, and we try not to enter into armed conflicts, well, plus this is like a secret uniform or something.
And what can you offer?
Yes, what guys bring trophies, so I bargain. Well, and on the little things to others, provisions there for example, medicines and equipment. I can offer you a job hunting for all sorts of mutants.
Got it, somehow I'll definitely take the task from you.
Why is this place called "Flea market"?

Ooooh, but you didn't find such places on the mainland? Let's just say this place is something like a market, but an unusual market. In fact, there are large hucksters, like your Sidorovich is not there, the guys are trading who is rich than what and who pulled out what, but they are trading! At night, here you can catch some nishtyaki, by the way. And the flea market has a long history within this place. Previously, the guys gathered right in the ruins of the building nearby, though until the loners drove them away. These freaks did not like the fact that they traded artifacts, but not anyhow, but at cost! Recently, they decided to revive the past, the Reds still dug in at their bar, and the bandits did not know about this place. The benefit of the building is inconspicuous and quite comfortable, I don't even know where that steel door leads. Well, I later nailed to them, as I noticeably began to take combat skills ...
Tell me about some mutants.

Well, then there are such cute rodents, they are popularly called "tushkanos." You saw them for sure. It does not seem to look dangerous, but in a flock they can easily bite even an experienced stalker, even a whole group. Here was such a case when a special unit of "Duty" went to clean the den of bloodsuckers. Well, count these idiots in a camp somewhere in the middle of the complex at the Agroprom, put down one sentry somewhere, and the other jerked off, well, there literally for 10 minutes no one guarded the sleeping people. Morning already means - it's time for the guys to wake up, but there is nobody. Well, something was wrong, they thought, they went into the room, and there the blood was covered - the sea and the throats of everyone were "bitten". Characteristic traces of jerboas appear, but they themselves have already fallen. The dog knows why they didn't stay for a meal, but to see smart nits. Well, the sentries still decided to go into the den themselves, and write off the deaths of their comrades as a bloodsucker. So they disappeared, and their handheld computer picked up a stalker, but with a new story came to the neighing bar. So that.

Well, every rookie encounters dogs at the cordon, not to mention on the mainland. They aren't much different from their, let's say, "prototypes". Blinded only, but it's not reassuring, because the other senses have become more sharp. Especially their sense of smell. They attack such inexperienced novices at once, as well as more experienced stalkers, in turn, with their agility and suddenness.\n So listen to the story. Someone in the bar was trying to steal some sausage at night. They got the whole place on edge, the guards got beaten up, whatever the hell they were doing. They even invited the Duty men to guard, and see who it is stealing, well, they sure as hell saw a dog that ran through a hole in the fence, and shot it. In the morning, the depressed stalker comes to the bar, asks about the dog, and the bartender immediately figured it out and told him to go to the Duty. That's how it was, the dude came from mainland with this dog through the cordon, it's his pet. Well, they went through a lot together, and he's also an orphan, and then this happened. Burers. There are such creatures that are legendary even sooner, the existence of which is much better for many not to know, otherwise you can run into fear. The best advice I can give is not to hang around dungeons and all sorts of raw empty complexes, including laboratories, because these creatures love such places. But recently they have been noticed everywhere and this is primarily due to the actions of the Tagged, who turned off the burner. Chimeras, for example, also lived only close to the center of the zone, but then they suddenly migrated sharply and increased their population. Apparently, someone who runs all this in the center of the zone has influence over these creatures and used them as a kind of Cerberus on the last approaches to his "citadel". If you've got into trouble and couldn't escape, I advise you to take care of your head, since they have relatively powerful telekinesis, they can also send a directed impulse and knock you down, they can take your weapons away or exhaust you, influencing gravity in some way . They look like fat and nasty dwarfs who like to wear huge boots that make characteristic sounds and black cloaks, oddly enough, stitched to them almost in size. I think that they, too, are a consequence of experiments in secret laboratories. \nThere are also different subspecies of these creatures. For example, fiery or electric, like poltergeists. In general, some agree that poltergeist is an evolutionary step of the burer. However, if an electric poltergeist affects you only by telekinesis, then an appropriate type of burer can easily throw ball lightning at you or an entire electra, the size of a substation.

Many here do not believe in paranormalism, and indeed everyone has a different faith here. Some have their own strengths, some have all kinds of Masters there, and some have alien intervention. But certainly not in God. However, there is still such a monster called "poltergeist", because how else to call translucent flying garbage that throws objects at you? True, this mutant does not have anything similar to religious themes on the topic of restless souls. He is killed in a completely ordinary way, he doesn't react to salt (we already had one that we checked) and looks like a flying electric, or less often a fire essence. Electric, like a burer, is showering you with all kinds of objects, but the fiery one is already capable of somehow creating jets of fire right in front of you, similar in effect and parameters to frying. Shoot directly at the essence - you will not miss, but it is very difficult to kill him because of his speed and maneuverability. \ nThere have been times that stalkers of a black or smoky poltergeist have seen. Reliably nothing is known about its properties, but this is a rather rare instance, and in many ways probably because meeting with such means death in the vast majority of cases, and killing this is even more difficult, because the smoke is much less localized and its core can be tracked very very difficult.

There are also creatures about whom many tales of bonfire are stacked. And these are kinks. If you have the desired item, then it's better not to rock the boat and give him what he asks for, and then go in peace for all four, he will not touch you. Well these are stories. The chimera can rightfully be called the top of the food chain of the zone. Why? This is a very smart creature, mostly a night predator that can fly at you from a distance of several tens of meters. The four-legged mutant has two heads, for which he received his nickname. Also very strong and sharp claws, capable of breaking even the skin of a pseudo-giant. They emit a characteristic roar in a jump, they also resemble a person in some way, they met such zones mainly in the North in open places, in the presence of any objects. As the local hunter, St. John's wort, told, they have their own sphere of influence, where they rest, and later they hunt at night. \nThere is also its subspecies, namely the black chimera. Such darkness cannot be discerned at all and this makes it much more dangerous for relatives (ordinary people have almost human skin color), they also say that it is stronger and more enduring. It's impossible to run away from the chimera, it's better to find some narrow room that will reduce its ability to maneuver or try to jump to the side while it flies towards you.

Boars and flesh. \nThe flesh is a sample of the eerily mutated pig (as scientists have shown), rather slow and weak, only a complete moron can get under its "wedge-shaped" paws, which she will certainly break through almost any vest. \nBoars are not much different from their congeners outside the zone, except bigger and more dangerous. And the hooves are much stronger and can cut through any fabric without any problem, just like human flesh. All you have to do is jump aside when that carcass comes at you about a couple of meters away from hitting its fangs. Often the meat of both boars and flesh is eaten, if the possibility of radiation poisoning is minimized.
